Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: Location was good. Room small but fine, bathroom good. Breakfast very average. There are some stairs from the street to reception. No one offered to help with my bag even though they could see I was struggling however once I was booked in someone was available to take my bag in a lift to my roomâ€¦ and of course a tip. Very overpriced for what you get, not good value for money! We had dinner in the hotel 1 night which was good however the service was a joke with the staff standing there joking and chattingâ€¦. Very unprofessional! This was my 3rd time to Venice and certainly will not be my last but would not stay here again and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Dparody
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concordia, Venice This was my fourth visit to Venice but the first stay at this Hotel. Our arrival, with a nine month old baby, was to be by ship as we were at the end of a cruise. Fearing travelling through Venice on a Vaporetto with pram, three suitcases and a baby was enough to put anyone off travelling. So with this in mind we had called ahead and arranged for collection by the hotel. And this is where it starts to go so well. Guiliano, the Concierge made all the arrangements, we were met by a driver who took us to to our water taxi and as the Hotel does not have a dedicated landing pier, the porter is there to meet you and take your luggage. It went seamlessly and took out any hassle related to haggling your fare with the water taxi, etc as these are all pre arranged by the hotel. Despite an early arrival, the room was ready for us which was superb as it was baby's time for her morning nap! The room was excellent. Furnished in a grand old style with silk wall coverings and the piece-de-resistance being the balcony with a view onto St Mark's square. Better still is the designer bathroom that would not look out of place in a modern design magazine, complete with heated flooring and power shower. The room was spacious by European standards, including flat screen TV with a selection of international as well Italian channels. The downside to this room? Bells, ringing from everywhere. The Tower, the Bascilica and the Clock Tower. And they don't all shut-up at night either. Keeping the windows shut helps but with a ban on air conditioning until May, it made for a stuffy night. Despite that, being able to stand on the balcony and hear the music being played at Quadri was worth it. Breakfast was served, not in a terrace as advertised, but in in the dinning room. Plenty of fare to be found at breakfast with very pleasant staff to help you along. But it was the front desk that makes this hotel work so well. From pre-empting your request for your room key, to addressing you by name. Staff could not be more accommodating to help us with the baby, storing the pram nearby and generally fussing over her. The staff would not allow us to dine at any of the tourist traps of Venice and were adamant that we eat only where the locals would eat. Their recommendations were worth it. This hotel deserves five stars for a level of care and attention to clients that is sadly missing from so many in the hospitality business. It has made our stay in Venice so much more special and memorable and I for one know where I will be staying next time I visit this wonderful city. Thank you Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Joan G
Reviews.Content: we visited in March 2012,having been to Venice on many occasions and stayed in several venues. This hotel was choosen for its central location, it is always a bit like pot luck when you do not know the hotel however the Concordia was excellent. The staff were welcoming and helpful from arrival to departure. Our room was small but had all we needed. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: The service from everyone in the hotel was excellent and could not be faulted. The hotel itself is a quiet haven in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the 'centre' of Venice. Food good /wine /hotel interior /room/comfortable bed/sheets changed nightly all good. Very central and easy 3mins access to the San Marco Lilaguna motorbus/watertaxis to San Marco Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: carib_visitor
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice and selected the hotel as part of a package of flights + hotel. Had been warned Venice was expensive. Overall it was what we expected. On the one problem we had, the staff were very helpful. (The wireless internet service was down and they offered the use of the office pc to check in on flights). Location was great but finding the entrance was a slight challenge as it is on a back street. Room facing back street was small but what we expected. The weather was unseasonably hot and the first night with open window was noisy and tropical (mosquitos). Second and third nights we had ac and it was relatively quiet and comfortable. If you stay on the square you need to expect chimes and city noise(reference other reviews). We did not eat an evening meal as the price was prohibitive (E55pp). You can eat well for 2 for that price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Pleased”
Reviews.Author: WiseTravelingGeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, travelling with 2 children. The location was perfect, less than a 1 minute walk from the Plaza San Marco (the "downtown" of Venice). We found it very easily, no need to ask for directions or a map. The staff was very nice and polite. We had a fast and easy check in. Cons: The room was very small. This is not the ideal place if you are travelling with children. We were cramped and were always trying to get out of the room and into the streets. Also, the hotel does not use air conditioning until the end of April, which they said was a regulation enforced by the city of Venice. The room was very hot, so we had to open the windows. Then the mosquitoes attacked us, especially during the nights. We got no sleep at all because the mosquitoes kept on buzzing around our ears. Also, because of its central location, it was very loud. You could hear the church bells well after midnight, and starting at around 6 AM, you could hear the surrounding restaurants getting ready for the day. Overall, our stay was very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, good standards”
Reviews.Author: john w
Reviews.Content: We booked through Citalia and had superior double rooms which were well furnished and a good size with big bathrooms. We had breakfast in the hotel and this was good quality continental style. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant. The welcome drink was just that and we were offered a second glass of the prosecco, which we accepted. We were offered a free visit to Murano which we did not take up.The staff were always welcoming and helpful. We liked the proximity to the water taxi stop because we did not have far to wheel our cases. This is a factor to bear in mind when choosing an hotel in Venice. It was pleasant and convenient. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “balcony on st. marco square”
Reviews.Author: 723brian
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at this hotel. What a friendly staff that take care of everything. We always get a balcony suite overlooking the square. The room is so quaint, the view is magnificent. You can watch the crowds and drink your bottle of wine. How romantic it is. Close to the action, restaurants and shops. If you stay over saturday night you can go to the casino down the grand canal by public water taxi, go past the Rialto bridge. Extremely safe at all times. The next morning, get up early and go to mas in St. Marco church. (go in the side door near the hotel) If you are travelling on a cruise that is leaving from Venice , you arrive a day early, stay at the Concordia, enjoy the city, take the tours then leave on your cruise. Never arrive in venice the day of the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4*. My mum stayed in a 3* hotel better than this in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Lovematlos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend last year for my 40th birthday with our 2 sons. Sorry I took so long to leave a review but I have only started writing reviews on Trip Advisor and there is a few things I want to write about this hotel. (bear in mind it might have changed after a year!) The location: on St Marc Square which is great, but then Venice is so small and the transport services are so reliable that you could stay pretty much anywhere... The welcome drink: we were made to attend a welcome drink even through we just wanted to drop our bags into our room and get lost in Venice. At this "welcome drink" we were offered some special cocktails and bruchettas. When asked what our sons could have we were told that the free drinks were only for the 2 adults and that we would have to pay for the kids... Then within minutes of forking out 3 times the normal price for sodas for our "not so important kids" all sort of people turned up to sell us their "exclusive" excursions, their "finest" a la carte dining etc. So be aware if they still do it, this is not a welcome drink this is a trap! Finally the rooms: Ours was nothing like the ones on the pictures! It was small dated and decorated by a 3 year old! The blue dirty wall paper peelling off in some places, the pink carpet in a terrible state and the bed covers of suspicious colours. We overlooked the back street which was very noisy (although we did not mind that it is Venice on a week end!) and thanks god we were not on a romantic weekend as we had twin single beds! If I had booked a 2 or 3* I would have rated it great. But as a 4* and for the price it was very very poor. I would not go back to this one (both my mum and aunty have stayed in better and cheaper 3* hotels in Venice.)

Reviews.Title: “Still a suberb hotel after many years”
Reviews.Author: outpaddling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel many years ago and had fond memories of our cozy little room overlooking the plaza along with the friendliness of the staff. Recently, I was pleased to discover that Concordia is highly rated by Trip Advisor after all those years; but, we still had concerns that the reality might not live up to our romantic memories. Luckily, the hotel and their outstanding service did not disappoint and in fact exceeded our expectations. The upkeep of this very old building is simply amazing and I applaud the dedication of the owners. One thing we did differently this trip (and now highly recommend) is to ask the hotel to arrange transfers inbound from the airport and later outbound to the train station. It is expensive, but worth every penny if you have luggage. Thank you Concordia! We had a fabulous stay and hope to return once again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything but fabulous service is always a bonus!”
Reviews.Author: Lesley O
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled through Europe for five weeks in December and January 2012 and stayed at Concordia for four fabulous days prior to Christmas 2012. Upon arrival I realised to my dismay that I had left our passports in Rome. Upon realising what had happened (as I rifled my handbag) the reception staff at Concordia took care of tracking down the documents, liaised with the hotel in Rome, spoke with DHL and had the problem sorted without missing a beat. They were even so kind as to not make me feel like a fool. We were then fortunate to be upgraded to two gorgeous rooms overlooking St Mark's. The rooms are spacious by European standards with beautiful old world decor. Staff were helpful in organising a tour of the Grand Canal and a trip to Murano - making suggestions without being pushy. One of the best places we stayed on our trip. Highly recommended and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and traditional fantastic room .”
Reviews.Author: Aborda T
Reviews.Content: Wonderful locatÄ±on , you can watch San Marco Square from your room window and can take good breakfast in the morning.I advise really , good choise for Venice accomodatÄ±on .

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast overlooking San Marco”
Reviews.Author: dorettat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous week in Venice. We didn't have the greatest room at the Concordia, but it was lovely and clean, with period furniture, a Murano glass chandalier and a gorgeous glass bathroom - pale gold mosaic tiles, and accented with a very modern glass vanity. The location is about as perfect as it could be. The staff is polite and helpful. Breakfast was lovely and included. People seem to be complaining about the wifi... it works fine. You just have to ask at the desk for a sign in name and password; its free, and good for 24 hours (but you can get a new one every day). We would absolutely stay at the Concordia again and recommend it whole heartedly. Oh -- and best mattresses EVER. I actually pulled the bed apart to find out what it is and we are going mattress shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Concordia is an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: venusb
Reviews.Content: Last year 2011 in April my mother and I stayed at this hotel. WOW!! great reception!! The room was fantastic, there were antique furniture in beautiful condition. very clean and larger than expected. The bathroom was a beautiful marble and very large. We had the room across St. Mark's cath. listening to the bells chime was enchanting. We did go to Murano which was really a waste of time but the hotel paid for the boat ride there. We then had a choice to go back to Venice for free or go to Burano and pay to go back. We decided to go on to Burano. What a quaint little town, like Venice but smaller. We ate at a small restaurant which was expensive but very good. well worth the trip. The staff at the hotel was helpful, polite and courtious. The location was perfect amid the meandering alleys of Venice. I would go there again . The breakfast was a good buffet. all in all it was a great experience. easily accesible by boat and and a small walking distance. So Yes..Yes to this reasonably priced hotel.. so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was just somewhat helpful..Lighting in the room awful if a person wants to read. Try for a room with a balcony overlooking St Marks Sq. Breakfast was good. Hotel seemed clean. Can rather easily get to the hotel for St Lucia Station by public water taxi. Line 2 goes to the San Marcos dock. From the dock just walk thru the SQ and go to the left side of the Basicilla -- look up aand there is the hotel. Entrance is on the back stree. Form the San Marco dock there is 1 bridge to cross. IT DOES NOT HAVE STEPS so is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF VENICES BEST HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011. The entry is hard to find but once we did find it the doorman helped us up with our luggage and welcomed us with a bright and cheery manner. The desk staff were extremely polite and nothing was a problem. The room was great (we booked one that overlooked St Marks Square), clean. roomy and tidy. The hotel is boutique type hotel bust is one of the best we have stayed in all of Europe. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone travelling to Venice. It is also very central to the main areas of Venice including good restauarants, shops and bars.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: SmartGirlsTravel
Reviews.Content: There are so many different luxury hotels in Venice, and many of them have charm, but Hotel Concordia exceeded my expectations with its amazing service. The staff were all very friendly and conscientious. I have never seen so many smiling faces as I did in the hotel restaurant, La Piazzetta. The food is beautifully prepared. I loved Hotel Concordia and La Piazzetta so much, I wrote a full review about the hotel's history and the peope who work there. Read the full article here: http://www.thesmartgirlstravelguide.com/only-hotel-overlooking-saint-marks-square-venice/

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana R
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my first visit to Venice very nice! It's clean, confortable, very well located and the team is helpfull and very kind. The only negative point is, although they tell internet "wi fi" is free, the "wi fi" does not work at all! Don't do the touristic night tour they suggest, cause the boat is closed and you can't see anything around you. It's better to take a traditional gondola or take a public bus transportation to see Venice by the see. On the other hand, the violin concert they suggest is wonderfull.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: arewethereyet64
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who has travelled to Venice frequently on business. We were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived the service was fantastic, from the doorman to the front desk and the staff in the bar/restaurant they were helpful and quick to respond to any request. The breakfast buffet that is included in the price was very good and well stocked. We didn't eat in the restaurant, so we can't comment on the rest of the menu. The room was nice and well appointed, if a little on the small side by North American standards, but it did fit the king bed and a pull out couch and cot for the kids. In the morning you'll be awoken by the bells from the square starting at 7. It's well located off San Marco and is a great location to explore the city from. As mentioned the service was great, and ultimately saved us from missing our flight home. After our prearranged airport transfer boat didn't show as expected, I returned to the hotel for assistance. Not only did the desk staff get the issue resolved immediately and get a boat dispatched, they sent one of their staff back with me to the dock to ensure everything was OK. One of the desk staff also had to run through San Marco to catch us and make sure I had the receipt for the boat driver. With their assistance we barely made our flight, without it we would have been trying to make alternate arrangements for flights home. If we're back in Venice we'll be staying here based on service alone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the luxurious boat ride to Murano”
Reviews.Author: Hardiman_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and loved the big room even though it didnt overlook the St Marco Square or Church. It was handy to everything really ,whether it was to listen to the music at the table or to catch the vaporetti over to the Lido for a swim in the Adriatic sea. Also the hotel offers a launch ride to island of Murano to see how the glass is made. They also sell Missoni earrings there . You must buy 1 item to get the launch for free other wise you pay for the vaporetti back. Its nice to have time there at murano for lunch and shop for Murano beads. The hotel gave us orange juice while our room checked on arrival. Breakfast was generous and I would stay there again because it wasnt too expensive and a beautiful decor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: alljs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel! Excellent service. Great value. I was traveling alone and decided to upgrade to the room with the balcony overlooking St. Marco's Sq. This was where I ate my breakfast which was promptly delivered by room service each morning. What a wonderful treat! Opt to take advantage of their private water taxi service to the hotel if arriving by train and if you are traveling more than one (heavy) bag with you. The public water taxi is very crowed and the 5 min walk they speak of seemed much longer and included more than one set of stairs over the narrow canal bridges. You can be sure I took the private water taxi back! Would definitely stay again and look forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Anniversarycouple86
Reviews.Content: Staff at the hotel was welcoming and professional. Greeted visitors with a complimentary beverage in a lovely little parlor. Our room was small, but clean and sufficient. Location in St. Mark's Square was wonderfully convenient. Also made it difficult to get lost. It is not on a canal, so it does require pulling your luggage across St. Mark's Square to get to either the water taxi or the water bus when arriving from either the airport or train station--but it is only a five minute or so walk. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “People, working there , are treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Irina94
Reviews.Content: To be very short: the hotel itself is quite simple (the building is very old!), but very clean, rooms (we stayed in 315) are not big, but for Venice spacious enough and tasty, everything worked perfectly. Location is N 1, very central. What we liked there the most were staff members: everyone was very helpful and friendly! We would write this review even without what happened to us after we checked out, but we should mention here how hotel staff helped to solve our (not their!) problem. Our daughter left her backpack with toys in water taxi on our way from the hotel to port, and we only could askthe hotel staff to try to contact taxi company when we were on board the cruise ship a few hours later. They found it, got it back to the hotel and kept for us the whole week while we were sailing! When I come there after the cruise they did not charge anything and even treated me with my favourite esspreso!... When in Venice again we know the right place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charm”
Reviews.Author: Rickim90
Reviews.Content: We loved the warmth of the staff, the beautiful room, wonderful breakfasts and location - extraordinary!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Pillows. No view. Okay Service....”
Reviews.Author: reedg21
Reviews.Content: My Family and I went to stay at the Hotel Concordia. We were put on the 1st floor hardly looking down to the street. The pillows were terrible and hard to lye on. The service was okay but we had to wheel our suitcases up the stairs when we finally found the place. In the morning we went down to a buffet breakfast. They fruit was nice, also the Hot Chocolates were very good! The 'high speed internet' was not very good as you had it for only 3 hours and reknew for free. This was an average hotel but not the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Silawat_Tao_Bkk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Piazza San Marco, Venezia heart. There are many shops and restaurants. It is very easy to access to other places including Rialto, Piazza San Marco, and grand canal. The pier is very closed to hotel with 70 euro by water taxi from main train station along Grand Canal. The lobby is on the second floor. When arrived, we dragged our luggage on the stairs. But finally, the bell boy was help. The room is clean in classic style. The breakfast is continental breakfast, no egg. WIFI is free with ticket for 3 hrs. After expire, can request more. But it can be access only in lobby. The front desk try to offer some tours everyday. In overall, every average factors are compensated by the location.

Reviews.Title: “Close, but no cigar.”
Reviews.Author: cyasukot
Reviews.Content: Very close to St. Mark's, and nice enough inside. Expensive but very well done food at the restaurant. Unfortunately, a very unhelpful front desk staff member colored what we thought of our stay. We asked if there was a computer available for us to use to check in for our flight and print our boarding passes. There was, but the man at the front desk didn't want to bother with us. "Can't you just use your mobile phone?" he said, exasperated with our extreme request. (He was similarly unhelpful in terms of explaining our options for transport to the airport, sighing as he looked up the time table of the waterbus). The hotel has no wifi so checking in on our mobiles took us more than half an hour. Very different from the excellent front desk service we experienced elsewhere in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel overlooking St. Mark's Square--Travel agent review”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night post-cruise--3 rooms, parents and young adult children. Although not located on a canal, the location is great! 1 block off St. Mark's square and a short walk to all the things you want to see. The rooms, while not modern, were very nice and the bathrooms were great. We booked the lowest price rooms--but I had a view of the dome of St. Mark's. They have a small bar and a nice restaurant--can't comment because we ate elsewhere while walking around Venice. Reasonable prices for Venice. I found the lowest rate on the hotel site. Staff speaks English. You get the hard sell on tours when checking in, but no pressure. They didn't offer anything that you can't do yourself by buying a Vaporetto ticket (Venice's Metro on the water) and having a good map. I communicated with the hotel prior to our trip about arranging transfers from the port and to the airport. They arranged this for us--prompt, efficient--no issues. The transfers were less expensive than I had found anywhere else, although still outrageously expensive, but we had 7 people. Cons--the bells at St. Mark's ring every hour around the clock--whose idea was that? And the hotel has the tiniest elevator I've ever seen! Can't find my room photos--they seem to have disappeared-but all of the rooms are different. Thanks so much Juliano for your help prior to our arrival and during our stay--your help was invaluable. I will be recommending your hotel to my clients who travel to Venice and I really hope to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “service...service...service”
Reviews.Author: Val-Kurt
Reviews.Content: I decided to give my partner a surprise trip to Venice, with the idea to ask her hand in marriage. You can imagine the stress trying to arrange a 4 day romantic stay with all bells and whistles. If you have the same in mind...book this hotel! The staff is VERY friendly, have an eye for detail and they really take care of their guests. The hotel is clean and comfortable, we even got an upgrade room at no extra cost and the food was outstanding. We came by boat taxi and the front office clerk was waiting with boots as there was a flooding. Great stay, great people, excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Barry_Patricia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent!! It was right at San Marco square and close to everything. The rooms were perfect and clean and breakfast was included. The concierge was our best friend and really did a lot to make our stay in Venice very special. Recognize the being right on San Marcos square means you hear the church bells very late at night and early in the morning. We were there for a few days and it was nice ... BUT some might find that annoying. We'd absolutely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely and stylish!”
Reviews.Author: ozeboy
Reviews.Content: I especially loved the courtesy and helpfulness of all the staff. The styling of the bedrooms, as well as a lovely bathroom.. Overall a very good value for money! We also found a good deal through a hotel comparison site: http://www.etrip.net/Hotel/Hotel_Concordia_Venice.htm which was great

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very poor management/reception staff”
Reviews.Author: MadHerts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel and, in all honesty, would probably not stay there again. The hotel itself is very nice, if a little pricey but so is Venice. We arrived as a party of eight to celebrate a birthday and had booked four rooms for three nights - a large sum of money. On arrival we were told by reception staff that they didnt have enough rooms available due to some building work next door - consequently, as we were the last to arrive, we would have to split up and some of us would have to stay in another hotel. Although we were not very happy about this, we agreed that we would do it for the first night until rooms became available the following morning. We were told by the manager that this would be IMPOSSIBLE as they had more guests arriving the following afternoon and it wouldnt be fair to these other guests. It would appear that they were happy to split us up as they could almost guarentee that we would all meet up and eat in their restaurant anyway. The 'superior' hotel that they moved us to was the Columbia consisting of some annex rooms at the back of the main hotel, a third of the size of the rooms that we had booked, with a major heating problem - I had to go outside the room at 3:30am to cool down as the room was so hot. We did finally manage to get back to the Concordia where the manager expected us to feel extremely greatful for getting us back in - no apology or compensation were offered. I fully agree with the earlier comment regarding the 'special' deals that they offer - they are very expensive. A shame as the hotel itself is in a prime area, very central to St Marks Square. Would I recommend it - only if they change the Management / reception staff ( apart from Gulianno) or if they invest in some people skills training!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: photogirlOZ
Reviews.Content: This was fantastic service from start to finish. wonderful friendly staff who accept you no matter where you are from and what you look like. we got complimentary cocktails and food on arrival, the staff were extremely fantastic to our children ( 9 & 11) and our kids still can't stop talking about the special hot chocolate that the staff made for them each night. The restaurant was beautiful and candle lit at night, and the meal we had the first night was one of the best for our whole trip. It was right in St Marks square, but not on the busy side. you can hear the cathedral bells at night, so if that doesn't bother you then there is nothing negative to say. the staff organized all our tours, and they were fantastic. Venice is amazing, and i wish sometime in the near future to go back and stay at this hotel again. They helped make our stay in Venice a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Good Service, Polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Harrys_Was_There
Reviews.Content: In general Venice is an expensive play to visit. Apart from accomodation and food you should consider transfer cost around by boat, which is a significant amount. So, I highly recommend to stay as closer as possible to the Piaza S.Marco, to avoid extra transfer cost. Of course the cost of staying is higher, but it may be compensated. Under this aspect, Concordia is a very good choice. Just, few meters from Piaza S.Marco, clean rooms, warm and friendly. Staff is alway there to help and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Venetian atmosphere and outstanding concierge service”
Reviews.Author: khiker66
Reviews.Content: Rooms and bathrooms are beautiful with Venrtian chandeliers, heated towel racks, and iridescent mosaic tiles in the bathrooms. The breakfast buffet is first -rate, with cloth napkins at breakfast. The free wifi in the lounge is popular with the guests. The desk service is indulgent without being obsequious. This hotel Is much nicer than the usual austere hotel I stay at in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude members of staff”
Reviews.Author: mram18
Reviews.Content: When we got to this hotel (which apart from anything else it is near the main square and with very nice decoration) the members of staff offered us a complimentary trip to the murano island. We were waiting for 45 minutes in the lobby without any information whatsoever when the water taxi will arrive. After i spoke to the reception the reply (with a very rude and angry manner) was " madam it is a water taxi not a car so it might be late" (nice one, as a tourist i should guess all that). After the taxi got there and after they realised at the island that we were not rich enough to make a huge buy we were offered a ticket to the local water-bus to get back (we were not usefull anymore). Of course the rude manners kept going as we had members of staff coming into the room without knocking at 9 o clock in the morning and when we complainted about it at the reception they didn't even look at me! The whole experience ruined my holiday as Venice is a lovely place but the members of staff of this hotel so rude that i would suggest to everybody: if you want to go to Venice make sure you are either very rich so you can buy something from their friends at the Murano island or pick another place as the minute they realise that you don't plan to spend a fortune they will treat you with disrespect! Absolutely horrified with the experience !

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel near St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: rlibraty
Reviews.Content: Clean, and very charming but a little hard to find. The standard room we had was equiped with a tv that must have been from the 1980's with only one english speaking channel. Also, they mention wifi which is very misleading. You must bring your laptop close to the hotel desk to actually get a signal. Breakfasts were great and concierges were hospitable. Very expensive meals though.

Reviews.Title: “Special treatment”
Reviews.Author: BlouBulJHB
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at the Concordia Hotel from our arrival when we were upgraded to a junior suite with a bottle of champagne on the house to enjoy on our balcony over looking the St Marks. We were sad to leave! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel overlooking St. Mark's Square!”
Reviews.Author: Labsngolf
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in an amazing location! Our room looked onto a street just parallel to St Mark's Square, so we could watch the shoppers, diners, and sightseers. Our room, which was the standard double, was very large by European standards. The decor and furnishings were the "old" Venetian style-elegant and refined. Of course, the lighting was all Murano glass! The huge bathroom was very modern and upscale. They had a lovely continental breakfast every morning. We did not have dinner at their main restaurant, but the descriptions of the daily specials sounded fantastic. If we ever return to Venice, this is definitely where we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Amy3376
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concordia for six nights at the end of September 2010. On arrival by water bus from the airport, we had some trouble finding the hotel as St Mark's Square was flooded so we could not cross with our cases. We had to try to find an alternative route through the lanes and it took about an hour to find it. If you are planning to stay at this hotel, ensure that you have a good map of Venice and plot a route in advance in case the square is flooded. This apparently happens around 60 times a year. It flooded three times during our six days there. Not due to rain, but high tides that overfill the drains. Anyway, it was such a relief to finally arrive at the hotel. There were stairs to negotiate with no lift, but the porter met us at the door and assisted with the baggage. We were taken off to the bar for a free welcome drink, which was a nice touch. We were then shown to our room. It was not huge, but adequate. At first glance it was quite old fashioned, but it grew on us and we ended up liking it. The bathroom was modern and had a shower over the bath, toilet, bidet and wash hand basin. We had a room overlooking the street/lane below, which was really the front of the hotel. There is not an entrance on St Mark's Square. There were rooms overlooking the square, but we did not have one of those. I don't know if that would have cost extra. The breakfast was good, plenty of choice and nicely presented. Overall, the hotel was extremely clean, we had no issues regarding the cleanliness, and it was in an excellent location for exploring Venice. A couple of steps from St Marks Square, a few minutes from the Bridge of Sighs, and about a 20 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. There were plently of restaurants, but the ones in the same street as the hotel were very expensive, so try going back a few streets for cheaper ones. Watch out for 'cover charge' and 'service charge' which really bump up the price of your meal. But I would recommend this hotel to others and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice--Hotel Concordia”
Reviews.Author: MichelleR24
Reviews.Content: We had some difficulty finding our hotel. The hotel and staff were nice. It was difficult to get luggage up the stairs, but the door man helped us. The room was very nice and clean. Great views of St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: comfortable_9
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice abit of a strange smell in our room (210) wether down to the kitchens below or the fabric walls. bathroom was big and modern. Very handy for St marks square and resturants. It did say that they had a rooftop terrace for breakfast but it is for one of the suites so you can not use it. Breakfast was nice buffet not loads of choice but enough

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: SK6
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, not the tourist trap I thought it would be considering the location of it. The rooms were small but quite charming I thought and we had a excellent view from our window of the main sights in the square, we had a great view of the fireworks display. The entrance hall was quite nice with its white marble and you really did breathe a sigh of relief when you got in there because of the crowds and heat. The staff were trying to push a special dining event but as we were not there for that long we decided against and it was no problem. There was a breakfast included in our option and all I will say is it was possibly the best cappucino I have ever had. Basically its a nice little old fashioned hotel with charm and a small elevator and you could not be in a better location in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Functional”
Reviews.Author: jt05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the middle of san marc square. Superbly located. The hotel is an average hotel with tight rooms and ordinary service. It is clean and functional but does not offer any of the charm of venice. The roms with a view had a small window through which you could barely see the square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Venice”
Reviews.Author: MickeyD777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found the rooms to be small but well decorated. At first they put us in a room with no view whatsoever so we complained as they were not filled up at all. They moved us to a 3rd floor room overlooking the commercial street in front of hotel and this was much nicer. Even though we were on a busy walkway, it was quiet as they had windows and shutters that kept the sound out. Don;t plan on being in a room overlooking St. Mark's Square as there are only 3 of these and they are expensive!!. The staff was friendly and helpful, in most part. They let me check my e-mail on the hotel computer one night when the internet cafe was closed. We experienced some pressure by one of the dinner hosts to eat at their restaurant in the evening. We did not plan on eating there as there are many places to experience in Venice and this person became a bit annoying. My wife became sick one day and we had to stay in the hotel. I watched TV and found that they only had one English language channel (BBC) so this made for a really long day. They claimed to have CNN but it was not available. All in all, a very nice hotel very near St. Mark's Square so it is very convenient to most tourist places (especially the gelato).

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Concordia was everything we hoped for & more!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationista3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has location, location, location! I traveled with my 67yo mother and 18yo daughter. We stayed here for 5 nights & had a junior suite overlooking St. Mark's Square. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated and had a large well equipped bathroom. Bath towels are soft and quite large. Twice a day the room was straightened, towels replaced, etc. Pillows were a bit flat and hard but fluffier ones can be requested through housekeeping. Beds are firm & extremely comfortable. I would caution that if you are a light sleeper the bells ringing on the hour in the square might be bothersome. We found it quite enjoyable and didn't even notice after the first night. We had breakfast each morning in the dining room. Cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, rolls, pastries, ham, proscuitto, various cheeses are available and included in the room rate. If you desire eggs, bacon, omelettes, etc. they are available for a reasonable charge. The front desk was very helpful with suggestions, dinner reservations, arranging transportation to and from the airport; etc. The hotel is close to two vaporetto stops and is situated close to many shops and restaurants. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: teamcoey
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect for exploring venice being situated right on St Mark's square. Rooms were nice and clean and the food in the hotel was lovely but expensive. I would advise making your own way to and from the airport using the water buses as this is much much cheaper and not that difficult.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Italomaniac
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Venice (and Venetian hotel rooms), I was absolutely delighted with the Hotel Concordia. By Venetian standards, the room size was quite good. The decor was charming, and the location is, of course, irresistible. Still, what impressed me most was the service. I had the misfortune to be unwell while I was there and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Everything that could be done to make our stay as comfortable as possible was done; with a smile. I am already planning my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “hotel concordia”
Reviews.Author: adamjneale
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights. right on the square. friendly staff, superb food. best hotel in the best city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good position but not all rooms have views.”
Reviews.Author: southamanda
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Concordia for 3 nights. The position of the hotel is excellent. 2 minutes walk round the corner to St. Marks Square. The room was very nice. All period furniture which added to the ambiance. Very clean with the maid coming in twice a day to make up the room and then turn back the bed in the evening. All the staff were polite, helpful and couldn't do enough for you. However our room overlooked the road that the entrance was in 'Calle Largo' so our view was the building opposite which was about 10 feet away. It could get a bit noisy in the mornings when the shop keepers came to open up because the Italians aren't very quiet people. We had room 101 and had we been there longer I think I would have asked to change. Previous comment about the bar area was correct. Very small!! All this said, I would return but ask for a room overlooking St. Marks.

Reviews.Title: “a little Venetian gem on St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: Laurawoodham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon in Venice with 2 nights at the Hotel Concordia. This had been recommended by a couple in a check-in queue as being the only hotle in Venice to overlook St Mark's Square. The location could not have been more central and our beautifully decorated room did indeed have this view! The hotle is small and personal and had a true Venetian feel. The staff were outstanding and helpful beyond what was expected - especially the manager George and the head concierge Giuliano. We planned to tour northern Italy in a hire car and Giuliano booked hotels for us in 3 other cities through Space Hotels (a collection of independent Italian hotels). I would go as far as to say that Hotel Concordia was responsible for making our honeymoon perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldDiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a double room, with another 3 family members in a larger room. The room was small, but this is Venice! It was very comfortable and quite lavish. The bathroom was very luxurious, but very small. The location is brilliant, it couldn't really be better. The reception staff are good, but every time we handed in or picked up our keys they tried to sell us a gondola ride. We organised our own, it was much cheaper. Breakfast was very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Not worht in spite of its great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lilly51
Reviews.Content: It has a great location. The people at the front desk were not very friendly except for one or two. The room we were given first was extremely small with a wiew to a roof few feets away. After complaining we were moved to a good one, but it had only one electricity outlet in the whole room, then we had to manage to recharge or use the normal devices once at a time. They offer wifi free but it was impossibe to get conected during the three days of our stay, this happen to every passenger with a notebook, there was no place in the hotel where to catch a minimum signal. The explanations always were Â¨we are waiting for the technician to come and see what happensÂ¨ of course he never arrived. VERY FAR FROM A 4 STAR HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong at this charming old world Venetian hotel in the heart of the San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMaverick
Reviews.Content: If you arrive by air, I would recommend taking the water taxi into Venice. It is well worth the 95E that you will spend. As you leave the baggage claim area, simply look to the left and you will see the water taxi desk. They will direct you to a pier and the taxi will be waiting for you. It is a 10 minute walk to the dock as you exit the airport , again make a left. Follow the plastic awning until you arrive at the waters edge. Once there tell the driver that you would like to go to San Marco's square and that you are staying at the Concordia Hotel. If you are lucky, when they drop you off, you will only be 1 bridge away from the front door. All this depends on water traffic and the tides. PACKING LIGHT is a key to negotiating this city. There are 3,000 streets, 420 bridges, and 118 canals. There are no cars or bicycles allowed in the city. It's you and your legs so make sure that you and your feet are very comfortable. Once in the hotel, you will be greeted by a warm, friendly and helpful front desk and staff. Rooms facing San Marco square are an upgrade but well worth the ambiance. It was a little chilly in March but I still opened up my window up to enjoy the scents of this wonderful city. Upgrades run about $30/night. My only complaint is that the beds are as hard as are their pillows. But the rooms/bathrooms are immaculate down to the crisp, pressed white sheets on the beds. I had two different rooms. The one on the second floor was decorated in a Venetian style and had a heated bathroom floor while the one on the 3rd floor had a modern look to it with a wonderful balcony over looking the square. This one also had air conditioning for the hot summers but no heated floor. The bathrooms are all done in venetian glass tiles which are beautiful in my opinion. The free continental breakfast offers something special for everyone. It was plentiful, fresh and had many delicious choices for any palate. The wait staff was attentive to your every need. The dining room was charming with its varnished wood and mirrored trim and white pressed linen table clothes. Negotiating this city is a challenge. Even if you buy a map, be prepared to be lost most of the time. (By the way, I felt very safe walking around Venice at any time of day or night). I would strongly suggest a personal walking tour by a woman by the name of Maria Teresa Simones. She is a tour manager with the International Assn. of Tour Managers out of London but lives in Venice. She is a wealth of information. The tour is 65E/person with a minimum of 2 people and 100E if you traveling alone. That is the booking fee if you go through the front dest. If you call her privately, the cost is less. Her cell phone number is [-]. She showed us where the authentic Venetian restaurants were located which is less costly than the more popular tourist traps and the food was delicious. My favorite was the Taverna del Campiello Remer at Cannaregio 5701. The phone number is [-]. It is a real hard to find gem. Maria also helped us identify real Murano Glass items. She was very helpful in negotiating better prices for me. There are quite a few knock offs from China around. She took us to historical sites, commented on all of the architecture and she got us a great price for a gondola ride. 70E. Most rides are a minimum of 95-100E. The walking tour is 2+ hours, she is a lovely lady, and it is definitely worth every penny. If you are going to do the tour, do it first for she will save you a lot of time and $ in the long run. Tell her that Donna and Hannah from Philadelphia said hi. And oh, if you are there in the winter and forget your gloves, don't buy any in the specialty shops, there is a street vendor near the Rialto Bridge who sells the same items for an average of 30E less. If you are planning to travel by rail to other parts of Italy from Venice, and you are buying your rail ticket on line from the states, be sure that you are leaving from the San Lucia station. I found out the hard way that there are 2 Venice stations and I got stuck leaving from Maestra which wasn't hard to get to by rail, but if you have rail connections, you might miss your train. If you are ARRIVING by rail to Venice, again, get off at the San Lucia station. Once there look for the water BUS to get to downtown Venice. It's a lot cheaper 6.50E/person to take the water bus to the hotel than a personal water taxi. If you are adventurous, get off at the Rialto stop and ask for directions to the hotel. It's an 8 minute walk if you don't get lost. If you have time, and don't want to drag your luggage over numerous bridges and steps, get off at the San Marco Square stop. It will be an additional 20-30 minute water ride but it is closer and less taxing if you are just arriving and have heavy luggage. Be sure to wave your bus ticket in front of a ticket meter. If you don't validate your ticket, and they happen to check it, you will incur a 50E fine. If you are planning on visiting other islands while in Venice, the most popular ones are Murano and Burano. Murano is famous for its glass blowing. The front desk will arrange a FREE water taxi for you. If you arrange it yourself, you will pay 95E to get there. Once there you will be greeted by the staff for that particular factory. You will see a demonstration which is interesting and then escorted in one of 8 display rooms in which they hope that you will buy something. Don't feel like you have to. I didn't and they weren't too offended. The next thing you know you will be escorted to the taxi, again free of charge to the island of Burano. It's famous for it's fishing and lace. You will see a lace museum which is fascinating and then they will want to sell you some lace. I didn't buy anything there either. I did at other stores but who knows if it was hand sewn. At this point, you will be hungry and I highly suggest eating at the El Gato Negro. (The Black Cat) The Risotto is to die for and the Amaretto Tiramisu is so good, you'll want to eat two of them. Then you are on your own to get back to Venice. We took the water bus back and it cost 6.50E/person. It took an hour and 20 minutes to get back with one change of bus. Ask where to change water buses for no one will announce anything and who knows where you will end up. Or, you can get a personal water taxi from Burano back to Venice for 95E and it takes about 15-20 minutes depending on the water traffic. Remember that the hotel is there to make money so everything they do and arrange for you is at a higher price because of the kick backs. DO let them arrange your water taxi ride back to the airport however. The price is the same, they assist you with your luggage and it picks you up very close to the Concordia. Tipping the staff isn't mentioned but I did give the maids a couple of E's/day because they did do some extra things for me. I also tipped the bell hops when they carried my luggage to the water taxi for me. For all of you who like Italian designer clothes, (both male and female), handbags, belts, shoes etc. but cringe at the prices in the states, there is a designer outlet in Florence. It's a two and half hour rail ride to Florence (Firenze) but it's really a lot of fun. There are 17 designer stores there; Burburry, Armani, Armani Jeans,Gucci, Belanciaga to name a few. Some prices are more than half off of New York prices depending on the exchange rate. Once you get to the right Florence rail station, (I can't remember if it's the first or second one that is closer) you need to buy another local rail ticket to the Riagano Station. It's another 20-30 minute local train ride. Once there, go to the taxi stand and take a 5 minute taxi ride to The Mall. (3E/person) It's really just called The Mall. The taxies run about every 5 minutes back and forth. I have two daughters in their twenties and they were in heaven. It's a long day but you can sleep on the train and it was fun to spend some quality time with just them. Just remember to get your tickets from the San Lucia station, not Maestra. I'd leave on the 8AM train from Venice and I would take the 5PM or later train back to Venice from Florence. That would give you 3-4 hours to browse around the stores. I have checked the box so that you can write to me if you have any other questions about Venice. Please feel free to write and I hope that my little blog has made your trip a little more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't get better but be warned not to eat/drink in the hotel bar”
Reviews.Author: khellings
Reviews.Content: Hi, Stayed here, for 3 nights went over to Murano island cost about 8 euros for both of us return on the public water bus service. Was happy with the hotel, but would not eat or drink in the hotel bar if I was to visit again incredibly expensive. Loved Venice would say 3 days was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Central and easy to find”
Reviews.Author: 1soupdragon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was central and very easy to find (unlike some) It is an ideal base for all of the sights.it is clean and well maintained. the food is well prepaired and reasonably priced for its location.The staff are friendly and helpful. However because of its proximity to the basilicas the bells chime on the hour at night and every half hour during the day,(eg at 11.00pm they chime 11 times) and can go on for 2 to 3 minutes early in the morning,ie 6am!!!.The noise from the allys can also be loud as the Cafes and bars serve late into the night. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and would reccommend this hotel and the city in general.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value”
Reviews.Author: wookame
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concordia 9/10-12/08 and had a wonderful experience. The concierge and staff were pleasant and accommodating. They offered several packages that could be taken advantage of. The four of us chose the one-hour water taxi ride at night, including a bottle of wine, followed by a delicious meal in the hotel dining room. The water taxi took us down the small canals as well as into the Grand Canal. It was well worth the money. Our room was splendid, and the bathroom was elegant. Our windows opened out onto the narrow street below, with the sights and sounds filling our room if we wanted. At night, we could close the big shutters and get a peaceful night's sleep. The location on St. Mark's Square is perfect. We would definitely stay at the Concordia should we ever have the good fortune of returning to Venice. It is a magical city, and the Concordia added to the magic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: FirstVisitToVenice
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by Water Bus which took about 40 minutes from the airport, the hotel emailed us before we arrived offering to organise us a water taxi for 160 euros - i wouldn't recommend taking them up on this offer as if you want to you will be able to get a water taxi from the airport which is cheaper than this (also on our departure they arranged one for us for 90 Euros!!) On arrival at the hotel they were very welcoming and gave us complimentary drinks and snacks in the bar whilst our room was prepared. Before we were taken up they did give us a 10 minute chat on the trips and activities which could be organised through them, not a hard sell but we were not really in the mood for this after travelling and just wanted to get up to our room and then get out into venice. We didn't take them up on any of the trips etc and organised our own itinerary so cant comment on value for money etc. Overall the staff were very helpful and pleasant whenever we had contact with them. Our room was attractviely decorated with a lovely balcony overlooking st.mark's square. Everthing was clean and maid service were very discreet. We asked to have breakfast on the terrace in the mornings which was brought up quite quickly and had a fantastic selection of tea/coffe/juice and plenty of bread, croissants, fresh fruit and jams etc. Bacon/eggs etc could also be ordered. We didn't actually have any meals in the hotel as we preferred to get out and about into venice and discover our own little places but it looked like a nice restauarant. The town itself is stunning, lots to see and do. Amazing architecture and beautiful little streets with canals cutting through them. Food etc can be cheap or v.expensive depending where you eat and what your budget is. We found restaruants on the Grand Canal were nice but staff not much personality or high customer service, much better atmosphere and experience in some of the small side street restaurants. Although a cliche we did love the moonlight gondola ride - definitely worth the money for the true venice experience. We had a fantastic stay and although had to check out by 12 the hotel had no problem with us leaving our luggage there till later and then arranged for a water taxi to the airport for us. One of the staff helped me fix my case which was a little damaged and the porter took all our luggage to the water taxi for us, a lovey end to a fantastic long weekend in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RACACA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located near St Marks Square. It's easy to find while you are working your way through the maize of Venice, since there are always signs to St Marks. It was a nice quiet, hotel, and the staff was very helpful. We arranged for private transport from the airport. We were met as promised, taken to a private water taxi and brought right up the canals as close as possible to the hotel and then met by the bellman at the dock. This is a wonderful first way to see Venice, and when we figured it out, it really wasn't any more expensive than if we had arranged for a boat ride later. The trip to Murano Glass which is included is also by water taxi. Having seen glass blown before, it really didn't rate highly, but again, the trip by water, especially back to St. Mark's square was very enjoyable. We also arranged for private water transport to the train station which was very nice down part of the Grand Canal. My only complaint was that the rooms are small, but they all are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ardamus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the concordia in nov 07. It is in the most spectacular position, right on st marks square. You couldnt get a better position! We found the reception area bright and welcoming, and the staff were really nice, they had a porter take our cases to our room, whilst we were taken through to a small bar area and were offered a complimentary drink and nibbles, which was lovely. Our room was gorgeous, a lovely large ornamental bed, nice ensuite and a fab view through charming shuttered windows, the room had everything we needed. Breakfast was ok, not as much choice as we would have liked though, cant comment on evening meals, as we went out. We would definately recommend this hotel, it is full of charm and character.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ejovanov
Reviews.Content: The junior suite we booked with a terrace was a wonderful modern room. The bathroom was normal sized for Europe (spilt into two seperate bathrooms, one for the toilet and the other for the shower/tub) and done in a nice gold tile, the room had a nice sitting area, and the bedroom was also nice with a lovely view of St. Marks and a small balcony. Then suite also included a roof-top terrace with a view over the Basillica and Piazza San Marco. The hotel served a candlelit dinner on our private terrace for 160 euros plus wine, but the view with classical music playing from the Piazza was amazing. The staff was friendly, and we did feel that they were in our room too much (on a couple occasions we saw them walking out of our room), but nothing was missing. They also offered us an outrageous "special price" of 190 euros for a gondola ride, but we were able haggle them down to 110 euros for a ride at dusk. Overall a very nice hotel. Amazing room with an even better view for a better price then most other Venetian Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: neeks12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Concordia in February for 2 nights. I stayed with my boyfriend (present for my 21st). Location was perfect. vey close to everything at st. Marks. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, but they will initially try and offer you trips etc... Breakfast was basic but nice-croissants, cakes, pastries etc. Rooms were clean and cosy. Great power shower!! Only downside with our room was the noise-could hear alot from outside-but your barely in your rooms!! (tip: when we got off the coach, we tried to be clever and just walk to the hotel-this took over an hour. We should of just got straight on a water taxi!) Venice meals can be pricey-just hunt around. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AlwariG
Reviews.Content: Arrived wednesday evening 9th April from airport with Alilaguna (12 eur per person) - took more than hour to reach St Marks Square - taxiboat specially for small groups better (100 eur). Just a short walk beside St Marks cathedral and you are there.Best location! We had two superior double rooms facing St Marks cathedral. The rooms were large and nicely furnished. Excellent bathroom. Church bells starting maybe 7 am may disturb a bit those sleeping late. Good breakfast. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Such Charm”
Reviews.Author: janiac61
Reviews.Content: A charming, beautiful hotel supremely located. Don't let the somewhat drab front of the hotel fool you. As you walk around to the entrance, which is in the back of the hotel, you will see the elegant entrance. The friendly staff welcomed us with drinks upon our arrival. Our room was very nice. We had a queen and had a separate small area that had a daybed/couch. The bathroom was pretty and clean. The included buffet breakfast offered fresh fruits, yogurts, delicious breads and other baked goods, cold cuts, juice, etc. This was a great deal as food in Venice, especially with the dollar falling in value, was expensive. The view from our room was one of the best memories from my trip. The windows open out and you can lean out of them and watch the hustle and bustle of St. Marco Square, and enjoy as the little metal man strikes the bell. In the mornings when the square is still nearly empty, you can watch as the peddlers bring their carts out and tourists start to arrive. The only caveat is that you can get better deals on the gondola by yourself than you can from the hotel, and the Murano boat trip factory they send you to if you take the free trip will try to sell you some very pricey pieces. After the glass factory salesmen realized we weren't going to bite and pay a couple thousand dollars for their items, they finally showed us to their cheaper rooms. We bought a trinket we probably could have gotten cheaper elsewhere and left to go explore Murano, which is very charming and had inexpensive souveniers by the boatload. Other than that, I would highly, highly recommend this hotel, which was easy to find. As you face the square, you go all the way back and to the right. The entrance is right across from McDonald's. One warning, there are many steps in this hotel and I don't believe there is a way up for the handicapped from the street. I may be wrong, but I don't believe there was an elevator from the street. There is one from the lobby, but it is tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: garrad
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice to find our original hotel had lost our booking, so the following day after spending the night in a 1 star hotel with paper thin walls, we made our way to the Railway Station and the travel agent found this hotel. It was sold as a hotel overlooking St Mark's square. When we arrived at the hotel we were met by a friendly reception. The room was very tasteful. The outlook from the room was fantastic onto the square. Unfortunately because of the late booking we were paying a high rate, but it was a relief to find something so nice to offset the bad experience of the previous night.

Reviews.Title: “Central locale”
Reviews.Author: Airrun
Reviews.Content: Really an unbeatable central location - right at the corner of St. Mark's Square. The staff was okay - we felt like we were being sold a bit with the staff making poor recommendations for likely tie-ins (reserved gondolas/murano day trip/etc) at higher than normal prices. The room we had was average based on our other experiences in Italy. We'd pick a new hotel next time, but do not regret trying this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrCleannw
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 wonderful nights at the Concordia hotel. We found the front desk staff extremely helpful. He spoke English very well, so I asked him how many languages he spoke. He said 6, thatâ€™s 5 more then I do. The house keeping staff kept the room clean and neat. I did have difficulty trying to work the remote for the TV, but we survived. The complimentary breakfast was the best I have ever eaten. The food was only surpassed by the staff that manned the breakfast room. Our next trip to Venice will be during the off season, in hopes there will be less people and a little cooler. Steve and Pat Silverdale Washington USA

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: wkspang
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two-night stay right in the centre of Venice, seconds from the basilica. Full of nice touches, such as the welcome drinks and the beds being turned. The room and ensuite were of a good size, though not sure it is of 4 star standard. The buffet breakfast was hearty. A slight downside is that being close to the basilica and the clock tower, you would hear the bells on an hourly basis, with the 7am one lasting for minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I believe staff steals”
Reviews.Author: appraiser95969
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there before in 2003 and in 2005 and I've always wanted to alert others that I walked into my room with staff going thru my luggage. I complained, nothing happened. Opened my luggage when arrived in Rome, my new leather coat, GONE! Called again to the front desk, sorry, couldn't help me. Rooms are nice, staff at desk is a little snoty, but they try, and the breakfast is real good, wireless in the lobby. Taught me a huge lesson about having good locks on my luggage and to lock it even when my hotel door is locked.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: skydriver
Reviews.Content: This is my only statement about "value", regarding the hotel and Venice: I thought I was prepared for the financial commitment it takes to travel to Venice ... yet I was still surprised by the expense of it all. I will do my best to describe the hotel, you the guest (who undoubtedly has a price already for the hotel) can determine if it a good value or not. The Concordia has a very central location, right of San Marco Square. It is swarming with activity; tourists from all over the world circulate outside like ants. It is not surprisingly very touristy at this location, and buyer beware with dinner, trinkets etc. We had great success with restaurants offering three course Menu del Dia for 15-18euro (not including drinks). The hotel is very clean, of course in an older building, but easily maintaining its elegance. The rooms were ample, the bed was unbelievably comfortable and it was surprisingly quiet. My room faced San Marco's, and I slept undisturbed. Do yourself a favor and open the windows to find wooden shutters, you can shut them first... then shut the windows; it really helps with the bells ringing every hour in the square. I didn't need the A/C in October, but it was available and in good working order. Breakfast was the standard stuff: cereals, cheese, procuttio, yogurt, fruits and bread. There is a menu for hot items. Everyone speaks English, and you will find yourself surrounded by fellow English speaking travelers. Getting to the hotel was exciting, once I let go of the cost. As a flight crew, we collectively hired a water taxi from the Motor-Pier. It dropped us off one small block from the hotel - 70euro. The water-taxis are large enough for at least 6 and all your bags (perhaps more) so there is a point when that option becomes economically feasible. I took the public transport to the train station (15euro for a 25 hour pass, bought at the front desk). That was easy enough, but the real treat was walking back to the hotel from the station. It was so quiet, no other tourists, relatively affordable restaurants and a much mellower vibe. As I got closer to San Marco, the streets were more crowded. We were in Venice for two days, and that was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: Corky12
Reviews.Content: You can not beat this location. When you get lost in Venice - and you will- you can always find your way back. I would not recommend the area around the hotel for dinner though. We tried a couple of places that were just OK. Our room was fairly big with 2 windows that we didn't open (it's very warm even in May). We had the air conditioner on which worked great. The bathroom was big also and the room was spotless. The breakfast was good and the staff was always there pouring coffee. There was a good selection of meats, cheeses, pastries and fruits. The front desk is effecient but they do try and push gondola rides and Murano trips. We took the gondola ride because they fit us in between the rain storms. This is a rip off. It was very expensive and you don't even get a 30 minute ride. Go some where else and bargain. We also took the Murano trip and that was excellent. You get a private taxi over and they give you a free vapparetto voucher for the way back if you want to wander around. You do have to watch the glass blowing but we wanted to see it anyway. There was no pressure to buy anything. All in all I would recommend this hotel- it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brodovsky
Reviews.Content: Loved the location Our room was very nice and we loved the balcony overlooking St Marks Square It is hard getting in and out of Venice with luggage There was a front desk person who was very pushy trying to get us to eat in their dining room, and buying one of their tours. It was him, the others were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MyaDevi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. It was literally within a few steps of St Marks Square and was central to everything in Venice. the hotel staff were very freindly especially Luca and Leigh. The breakfast was fantastic because it included fresh fruit salad, croissants, yogurt, pastries, just a great variety. the rooms were well maintained and the bathrooms were clean. the rooms were exactly what they looked on their website-decorated in rustic venetian designs. The hotel offered a complimentary tour of Murano where I was taken to glass factory and watched glass ornaments being made which was wonderful. A gongola ride ws also provided at a discounted fare which was also just breathtaking. Overall a fantiastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: garyp811
Reviews.Content: Great location, room 312 is fantastic with a balcony with view of St Markâ€™s square; you can fall asleep to sounds of the orchestra and wake up to church bells. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Grand Canal and all attractions just a short walk. If you have time take a vaporetto to Lido. Had the best vegetable soup in my life at Taverna S.Trovaso (near academia), make reservation for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Prices at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliedDublin
Reviews.Content: Excellant location, staff very accomadating, Reasonable room rates considering location, Room smaller that expected, just a few bits to keep in mind. We were concerned of how to get to this hotel from airport, as we were arriving quite late, & contacted hotel for help. They offered to send a (english speaking) hostess to pick us up for â‚¬150, I knew this was outrageous, condsidering our flight from Ireland did'nt cost this much. Fistly, everyone speaks fluent English & what they don't tell you is, it is so simple to just walk 4 mins to the public transport water bus service that runs til 12am, which costs â‚¬12. This takes you to St Marks Square where the hotel is a 5 minute walk. Also they offer night boat trips, for â‚¬120, when there's a service that runs them in town for â‚¬79. They offer gondala rides for â‚¬80, but stick you in with other couples, when you can get them for â‚¬80 on your own. They do offer you a complimently Excursion of glass blowers but its only â‚¬20 if you contact the sevice directly in town. Its â‚¬5 for a can of coke, â‚¬6 for a glass of wine, â‚¬12.50 for a bottle of water. There just some of the Hotel price's that "suprised" me. At the end of the day it's there business & I understand that, but I dont like to see people taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: epsteisr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the location and good reviews from this site. However, I found the rooms to be very run down and dirty. We specifically booked a room overlooking San Marco Square, based on the reviews we read and the pictures from their website. But, upon arrival when we were shown to our room - in order to see the square from the room, you had to hang out the window and crane your neck. We asked to see other rooms with the view, but found the same thing There is one room that has a true view of San Marco Square (the top floor room with balcony) and that is the one they have one their website. After seeing the "view" overlooking San Marco Square, we elected to downgrade to a room without the "view." The bathroom was v. poorly designed and when you used the shower, the entire bathroom got soaked. We found the management pushy - they continuously tried to get us to book a gondola ride shared with other people for the same rate normally charged for one couple. The one good thing I will mention is its proximity to San Marco's Square which was convenient. However, overall, I was extremely unhappy with the room, hotel and management. I wouldn't not stay here again or recommend this to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Room overlooking St. Marks, terrific”
Reviews.Author: Hughau
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple for a two night stay in Venice and was lucky enough to get room 316 overlooking Saint Marks Square. This room is a triple with a roof top patio overlooking the square. I spent an unblievable afternoon on the "roof" with my wife, daughter and a bottle of wine. If you can get this room, the location cannot be better. I only gave the hotel a 4 (above average) rating because of the cross selling done at the front desk. We were presented with several "offers" including the trip to Murano (which we declined). The Concordia should present such offers in a different manner and not waste our time. A better way would be to ask if we are interested in hearing about opportunities in the area coordinated by the Hotel. Arrival glass of wine in the bar was nice touch, and breakfast was better than average. The location was also very good...right in the center of things. Don't waste time with the public taxis if you have luggage, just bite the bullet and pay the Private Water Taxi 60 euros and they will take you close to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location friendy staff”
Reviews.Author: Hazel.Turner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from celebrating in style my 50th birthday, the hotels location is excellent, the staff cannot do enough to assist. Breakfast is very good and the dinner was extremly good and considering the loaction not overpriced for Venice. Rooms are tradtionaly furnished and the bathrooms are fine. I wouldnt hesitate to return. Just remember the closeness to the square there is a certain amount of noise especially the bells but after the first night you dont hear them

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelfunandwise
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location! Steps away from St Mark's. The front desk staff was more than helpful with restaurant recommendations, gondola rides and water taxi reservations. Free champagne and snacks when you first arrive. The room was very small, but adequate since we were only in the room to sleep and change clothes. The water pressure and temperature was the best we had all over Italy! But it is impossible not to soak the floor while showering... If arriving via valparetto with a lot of luggage hire a porter at the stop for 20euro and let him carry the luggage and show you to the hotel. If taking a water taxi, the walk isn't that far with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: conniesavoia
Reviews.Content: The location, right on the side of St Mark's Cathedral and the friendliness of a staff that was more than willing to speak English, made this a great place to stay in Venice. Seniors, particularly, will appreciate the closeness to major attractions and water transportation sites. We would return in a heartbeat. Our room had a view of the side of the church and was comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast included with the room price was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: AnitaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Concordia in July of 2006. We had two rooms, which were very inequitable. One was furnished beautifully, another looked as if it had been done in garage sale kitsch. One had a huge plasma television, the other a small unit that could not be seen from the bed. One had windows that opened onto the lovely street, one had windows that opened ten inches from a brick wall. One had a beautifully tiled bathroom, done in meticulously in small mosaic tiles of reds and coppers and golds, one needed a total renovation. When we tried to trade for a different room, we were told that it was not available. Desk staff was cold and curt.
