In a positive vein, the breakfast buffet was generous and tasty, though the dining room small and sometimes seating was not available. Wait staff was very friendly. Location is great. . convenient to everything. Next time I will seek a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful weekend at the Hotel Concordia in Venice's Saint Marks Square. The hotel is an oasis of calm in the busiest part of Venice. It was great to be in the middle of the action but at so much peace. The reception was extremely helpful arranging the water taxi's and gondala rides with ease. The room was very beautiful with a partial view of St Marks (amazing as it was the last room left in the hotel) Breakfast was excellent and everything was done to make our short weekend into a fabulous holiday. Now some tips to stop disappointment. 1. The loveliest way to arrive at the hotel is by water taxi from the airport, its about Â£60 but really worth it, the taxis are like floating limousines and really hassle free. 2. The advertised trip to Murano IS worth it but you must buy something at the gift shop to get back (which is fair enough as the glass factories pay for the aforementioned water taxi to take you there and back), a little horse like the ones they make in front of you only costs 10 Euro and is very pretty in its own right. Ignore any hard sell (we didn't and managed to bargain down a very beautiful glass sculpture, but we love it! ) 3. All gondola and taxi trips must be prepaid to the hotel in cash so its worth having a fair amount on you. 4. The gondola ride is expensive around Â£100 but very much worth it (believe me you'll kick yourself if you don't), do arrange it throught the hotel though otherwise you could get ripped off. 5. People say Venice is expensive but do try and think about how much you would spend in London for everything and it will stop you feeling that you are ripped off. Well I hope I've been of help, it really is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Concordia earlier this month and loved it. This was our 4th stop in Italy and the best hotel we stayed in during our visit. The hotel was easy to get to, a short walk (with luggage) across San Marco Square. We were welcomed with a glass of champagne. When we arrived in the room 15-20 minutes later, there was a plate of fruit waiting for us and robes were brought to the room shortly after. The staff was very helpful!! (We did not hear any "lies".) When we told the front desk we needed to be at the airport for a 6:30am flight, they were great in helping us with arrangements, starting with a wakeup call, arranging a private water taxi (we could have taken the public water taxi but would have had to leave 30-40 minutes earlier and 5am was early enough) and packing a breakfast in the morning for us to take with us. Everything was exactly as they told us and we arrived to the airport with no problems. The room and bathroom were large and well decorated. We had a room overlooking the alley (instead of St. Mark's), and although we could hear the sounds of people below, I would not consider it "noisy" (it was actually nice hearing the activity below us). We could also hear the bells of St. Mark's and now that we're back home, everytime we hear church bells we are reminded of our great time in Venice. I hope to return to Venice some day and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Celinebebe
Reviews.Content: We are writing this review on the last day of a glorious holiday from the comfort of our beautiful bedroom, thanks to the excellent free wireless internet service at the Concordia. The staff here are absolutely wonderful, from the doorman to the concierge, the maids and the bar staff - everyone goes out of their way to make your holiday that little bit more perfect. Situated next to St Mark's Square with first class facilities, the Hotel Concordia will definitely be a destination for us again in the future. A couple of points to note, you do get some noise from the street but this is to be expected from its central location. In addition, remember to bring mosquito repellent, we didn't and have been eaten alive - this is entirely our own fault and nothing to do with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Venice”
Reviews.Author: Carolinaribera
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Concordia Hotel in Venice. Cannot praise the city highly enough. The Doge's Palace and San Marco Basilica is just wonderful. Hotel is right in the centre of Venice with very friendly and helpful staff and the transport system is efficient and easy to use. You don't need to buy at the factory trips on Murano Island - just go to the shops in Venice being mindful of "you get what you pay for." Be careful in the restaurants tho' as they charge for every little thing and can sting you on the drinks. Hotel offered trips which were quite expensive but well organised and hassle free! 10/10 experience!

Reviews.Title: “until the last second (Honey Moon Couple)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i am amazed to see such a service for a 4stars hotel, i rated it 5 beacuse of the nice service they offer, and how friendly the staff are, as well, FREE Wi-Fi service aviable 24-7 for anyone to use at the loppy, as well they can provide you with laptop to use incase you dont have one. the location in the heart of all the shopping, and resturants. i am still in the hotel, leaving in few minutes, so i wanted to pay them back by writing something nice about them. if i got to come back again to Venice, i will for sure come to the same lovely Concordia. Gratsia :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jimbobmurgy
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see a few people complaining about the service they had received at this hotel. Having just returned from Venice, I found the hotel a fantastic base from which to explore La Serenissima. I had been to Venice a few times before, but this was my girlfriend's first time as part of my birthday present to her. Arriving by private motor launch (90 euros from the airport) at dusk was the perfect start. She audibly gasped as we entered Saint Mark's Square for the first time and saw it lit up in the late January gloom. The hotel is not on the main Piazza, but on the smaller Piazzetta Leoncini next to the Basilica and some of the rooms overlook the square from there. The entrance is on a narrow lane which runs parallel to the Piazza. A marble stairway runs up to the lobby and reception. As promised we were greeted with a complimentary drink and after 15 minutes or so were taken to our room. The room was small, but clean and decorated in the traditional Venetian manner. The view from the window was of a narrow alleyway rather than the square, but at 150 euros per night I thought it was more than adequate. The bellboy was attentive in the extreme and very courteous. Warnings of high pressure selling from the reception staff by others on this site turned out to be little more than offers of a "free" trip to Murano, but were declined with no more than a "No, thank you." and were not followed up. After a quick change, we headed out into the cold Venetian night. What can you say about this hotel's location? Literally 20 seconds from walking out of the front door you are in Saint Mark's Square. The Doge's Palace, the Basilica, the Cafe Florian, Harrys Bar, gondola rides, trattoria and osteria all within a five minute walk. If you've never been before take some comfortable shoes and your wallet. Venice can be extremely expensive, but head away from the main tourist areas and you can drink and eat for very reasonable prices. This weekend I spent 28 euros on 2 Bellinis at Harry's Bar (nice to say I've been, but I wouldn't rush back), 25 euros on a coffee and tea and scones in the Florian (would definitely go back, the classiest cafe in the World), and 40 euros for an afternoon of beer, wine and bar food in a little osteria in Castello about 200 yards from Saint Mark's Square. Have a great time if you go and remember that a hotel is a nice place to stop, but cannot compete with what is on your doorstep in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: benjaminwolf
Reviews.Content: We had a very memorable stay at the Concordia Hotel. I don't know how it happened, but we got the only room in the hotel with a balcony overlooking St. Mark's Square--Unbelieveable! What a surprise. A friend who was a former travel agent booked the hotel for us. It goes without saying that the location of the hotel is amazing. It is the only hotel on St. Mark's Square. Great Place! The room had a strange layout, with a short flight of stairs to the balcony, but the bathroom facilities were first class. Only rub was the advice about a trip to the Island of Murano. We were told that we would be given a free trip there and back. However, when we didn't buy anything we were abandoned on the Island. We lost precious time waiting for public transport back to the main part of Venice. My advice is not to go to Murano unless you are prepared to pay big bucks for glassware.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Concordia”
Reviews.Author: k_kiziak
Reviews.Content: We had Concordia Hotel recommended to us at the train station information. It was 150. euros a night. The hotel was located in San Marco Square which was excelent. We were greeted with a champagne reception by John the concierge. Breakfast was included in the price of the hotel and was very good. The hotel had air conditioning, which was a must. We thought we had gone to heaven after some of the other hotels we stayed in. The staff were very helpful and also we had no problem understanding them.

Reviews.Title: “Europe's Worst Concierge Desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of staying at Hotel Concordia, pick somewhere else and save yourself the headache that you'll get from all the lies that fly over the concierge's desk. The night we arrived we were told of a "beautiful boat ride" that was to take us through all the canals, including "the grand canal" as a tour of the city. We were told that the gondolas "do not operate at this time of night (11pm)" which was meant to be the nicest time to go. We were also told that "gondolas cannot go on the grand canal" but the boat can. Finally, the captain of this "romantic boat" was to come to the hotel at 5 minutes to 11 to pick us up and take us to the boat. All this cost 130 Euros and what did we get? Lies, lies and more lies. First of all, the concierge finished his shift and saw us sitting there waiting for the captain to arrive (he had earlier told us to wait in the bar, where we did so for 25 minutes!!!) and only then, as an afterthought, did he approach us and say "your taxi (yes taxi, all of a sudden it was not a romantic boat) is waiting for you downstairs, 200m on the right, just before the bridge." Then, the boat was merely a taxi. Nothing romantic just a taxi with the "taxi" sign taken off. Nothing more, nothing less. Furthermore, the driver did not say ONE SINGLE word. Forget about "guided tour" or "tour" of any sort. He just drives the taxi around and doesn't whisper a thing. Finally, and here's the best part, the following night we took a gondola ride, at 11pm, through the grand canal, for 80 Euros and the guy showed us famous peoples houses, historical landmarks, etc. I confronted the concierge about this and told him everything he said was a lie and unlike say the USA, where the customer is always right (and in this stage we most certainly were), he proceeded to say "I'm sorry you feel that way, you must have misunderstood me because of my poor English" which is rediculous because his English was that of an Oxford scholar. Also, whilst sitting in the bar, we overheard him "sell" this same "boat ride" to many guests, even though he told us "you are very lucky because the boat only operates on Tuesday nights." What a bunch of lies, everything this hotel's concierge tells you, don't believe them...all lies! They sent us to Morano to look at the glass blowing factories...or so we thought. It's "free" they said...so we knew there was a catch. "We take you there and bring you back." Of course, they did take us there...but when we asked how do we get back (after not buying anything) they said "the ferry is just on your right hand side." You see, it's not an issue to take the ferry or go on a boat ride that's really just a taxi, but this hotel has a concierge that is trained to get you into these activities UNDER FALSE PRETENSES. Like another reviewer, we too checked into a "non-smoking room" that stunk of smoke. The concierge said they cannot control if someone previously had gone against their request and smoked in the room. So we asked to change rooms, which wasn't a problem, but there were of course more lies when I asked "but if it is truly a non-smoking room, then why on earth does it have an ashtray in it?" The response was "it gives people a place to put things, such as coins." I mean, seriously, if you have any sense save yourself the grief and check-in elsewhere. If you see the size of the bathroom alone (which can barely fit the toilet), you'll thank me for it.

Reviews.Title: “What a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Concordia Hotel is easy to find just off the back of St Marks Sqr. The entrance is on the street parallel to the square. The hotel is clean, well appointed and has excellent service. The staff all speak good English and are more than helpful. The room, whilst small was delightful and the maid service twice per day replacing towels at the evening turn down. The location is spot on, minutes from the Grand Canal and at the start of the shops. The hotel staff will book water taxis for you and arrange trips, though watch the free glass blowing at Murano, it is OK but there is a hard sell at the end to buy their glass ware. As my wife and I are late 40's (early 50!!) we found this hotel to fit all the requirements. As for Venice - brilliant. Take plenty of cash for the transport though. The public boat from the airport to the hotel cost 10 euro pp, but is very slow taking over one and a half hours to reach St Marks. The water taxi took 25 mins, though cost 87 euro. Much superior though and you are not worried that you will be late for check in as the public one stops at every location!! Gondolas cost about 80euros - expensive, but you cannot go to Venice and not take one down the canals. Again, the hotel will book for you so you do not get ripped off!! Worthwhile trip - went mid June - Very Hot though.

Reviews.Title: “We felt the Concordia was overrated.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in the lack of quality vs. the cost of this hotel. We had been given this hotel name by friends who also felt it was overrated and over priced for what you get. The location is superior and it did make it easy to get to any tour place we desired by walking. We traveled with 5 American couples in the spring of 2004. One couple's room had a water leaking problem in the bathroom ceiling. The hotel did promptly change their room, but it was to a smaller room. Our rooms were small and rather worn. The hotel didn't push the Murano glass free boat trip. We did, however, take this worthless trip. It was definitely a ripoff. The boat dropped us off at an unknown dock and left us to find our way back alone. Prices at the Murano glass factory were overrated. Glass blowing demonstration was pitiful at best. Their "master" performed like a beginning student. I would not reccommend this hotel to another traveler.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Concordia
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Larga San Marco 367, 30124 Venice, Italy
